TopicTitle: KSP Quick Guides: Plane/SSTO Tutorials! *SSTO Video Just Released*

Articles.Content:
Hey!

I've started making a series of tutorials on Youtube that will cover everything from basic plane design, to some of the more difficult stuff such as designing and flying an SSTO to a different planet. It will start off covering the basics, but should quickly ramp up to cooler and more challenging topics.

I plan to release videos on a weekly basis, usually on Wednesdays.

Table of Contents:

Click the links to skip directly to the part of the video that covers the topic!

Episode 1: Building a Plane

  • Space Plane Hangar Controls and Hotkeys
  • Basics of Building a Plane

Episode 2: Flying Lessons

  • User Interface Basics
  • Understanding and Using the Nav Ball
  • Basic Flight Controls
  • Taking off
  • Using SAS and Precision Controls
  • Flying without SAS and Trim Settings
  • Basic Flight Maneuvers
  • Landing

Episode 3: Troubleshooting Your Airplane

  • Veering off the Runway
  • Unable to Get Airborne

Episode 4: Useful Flight Maneuvers

  • J-Turn/Herbst Maneuver
  • Immelmann Turn
  • Split-S/Reverse Immelmann Turn

Behind the Scenes: Building a VTOL

  • Different VTOL Designs

Episode 5: How to Make a VTOL

  • Basic VTOL Construction Techniques

Episode 6: Flying and Landing VTOLs

  • Finding the Hover Point
  • Using the Thrust Limiter!
  • VTOL Flight Controls
  • Flying a VTOL
  • How to Land

Episode 7: High Altitude Design/Flying - Primer to SSTOs!

  • Jet Engine Concepts
  • Air Intakes
  • Flameouts
  • Control Surfaces
  • Flying Tips

Episode 8: 2 VTOL Flying Tricks to Make Things Easier!

  • Toggle your intakes for rocket-like response.
  • Toggle your engines for a similar result. Best used for landing!

Episode 9: Building and Flying SSTOs!

  • Building an SSTO
  • Flying an SSTO

Episode 10: SSTO Re-Entry


Watch the Full Episodes Here!

I'll be making more and plan to release a new vid at least every week, so stay tuned!

Let me know if there's anything specific you'd like to have covered, or if any of the videos that I've posted could use more/less info. Thanks!

Hopefully some people find these useful

Ya the heli-pad landings can be tough to nail down at first. I plan to make a quick video showing off some extra VTOL flying tips which I've found/been shown by others recently.

As for the CoL/CoM/CoT question, I always recommend having the CoL behind the CoM. If it is directly on the CoM you'll have a design that wants to fly forwards and backwards, causing it to flip

If you're asking about the CoL being "in line" with the CoM and CoT, then no. The CoL can be above/below those just fine! The main concern with the bubbles is to have the CoL be behind the CoM and to have the CoT aiming directly through the CoM (the second one changes when you have a combo of horizontal and vertical engines though!)
